page.title: 05A WORKING MOTHER'S DAY
page.content: The mother in question works part-time as a teacher. She usually gets up at 7.30 and wakes the children. They have breakfast and she prepares a packed lunch for the whole family. She then washes the breakfast things and drives the children to school. At about 9.00 she leaves for work at a Grantham school where she is employed for 3 hours a day. She then drives to the Teacher's Centre where she has her packed lunch and works for 2 hours. She returns to collect the children from school and makes their evening meal, after which she washes the dishes and tidies the house. The children read regularly to their mother at this time and then she puts them to bed. The mother then has a cup of coffee, watches televsion and goes to bed herself at about 11.00.
